creator: bortolato@prosa.com
text:
I've an application (servlet and JSP) that works correctly under Linux Red Hat 
6.2 with tomcat 3.3.
This application I've move in a NT4 platform with tomcat 3.3 like first.
Here I've two possibilities:
1) If I work with port 8080, the JSP works correctly.
2) When I use IIS with connector I receive this error:
   "Directive 'taglib' on line '1 is not a valid directive"
The connector work correctly, there aren't any errors in her log.

I've search this problem in mailing-list and in search in bugzilla...
What I must do?
I think this is a bug...

There isn't enough detail to attempt to duplicate.  I am assuming that
the error was reported by the browser, perhaps because JSP source was being
served rather than the intended JSP output.
creator: Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
